Title: Arboretum Marsh Walk
Description: A small bench located along the Arboretum trail's floating walkway near Foster Island.

Title: Stanley Park
Description: This bench offers breathtaking northwest-facing views of Lake Washington.

Title: Pike Place Market
Description: While it can get quite crowded, this restroom provides a convenient option within the bustling Pike Place Market.

Title: Seattle University Ferns
Description: A quiet spot to sit behind Seattle University's administration building.

Title: Bench on Broadway
Description: A bench along north Broadway near the bus stop.

Title: Seattle University Rhorodendrons
Description: Located in front of the Administration building, this bench surrounds you with blooms of flowers every spring

Title: Woodworth Apartments
Description: Modern seating outside WoodWorth apartments across from Drip Tea Market.

Title: Kobuta Gardens Bench
Description: A zen, overgrown bench located in one of Seattle's best public gardens.

Title: Seattle University Fountain
Description: Peaceful people watching underneath trees on the upper mall next to the quad.

Title: UW Maple Hall Promenade
Description: The curvy wood on University of Washington's Maple Hall Promenade makes for good sitting.'

Title: Columbia Tower Club
Description: Frequently acclaimed as a hidden gem among Seattle's restrooms, this lavatory for women offers a stunning cityscape view from the 76th floor.

Title: Life On Mars Disco
Description: This disco bathroom behind door No. 2 is a groovy spot for selfies and handwashing

Title: LA Dive Bar
Description: Another selfie favorite, this bathroom will have you seeing red.

Title: Starbucks Reserve
Description: A softly lit, gender-neutral space with a panoramic view overlooking the roastery below.

Title: Stoop Brewing (Capitol Hill)
Description: A classic gender neutral bathroom with plenty of stalls for everyone to go

Title: U Village
Description: Private stalls with floor to ceiling doors and individual sinks make this spot a favorite rest stop among local shoppers.

Title: Arboretum Walk
Description: This small memorial bench provides a pleasant spot to sit along Azalea Way.

Title: Cloudburst Brewing (Ballard)
Description: Another solid brewery bathroom. Here, the sinks are situated outside.

Title: Cal Anderson Park
Description: A public restroom located in one of Seattle's busiest parks.

Title: Seattle Central College
Description: A gender-neutral, multi-stall layout located on the 4th floor

Title: Sinegal Building
Description: Cool place to sit in front of Sinegal building.

Title: ESPORTS
Description: A heaven for all the gamers.

Title: Lemieux Library
Description: Surrounding the books.

Title: Kubota Gardens
Description: Kubota Gardens.

Title: Great Wheel
Description: It adds an entirely new sightseeing perspective, thanks to its location perched on the end of Pier 57.

Title: Ferry
Description: Enjoy the breathtaking views from the bow of the boat as you cruise to the nearby communities of Bainbridge Island or Bremerton.

Title: Aquarium
Description: meet a few adorable sea otters, and greet the various sea creatures of the Pacific Ocean, from puffers to giant clams.

Title: Mono-Rail
Description: The designated historic landmark can reach a top speed of 45 miles per hour and weaves between skyscrapers above the city streets.

Title: Pike Place Market
Description: The market added its historic MarketFront expansion in 2017, featuring an open-air plaza and fantastic views of Elliott Bay.

Title: Central Public Library
Description: You’ve never seen a library quite like this—Seattle Central Library’s architecturally distinct structure boasts enough glass to cover more than five football stadiums.
